授業方法:
This course will be in an online format.
Short lectures and discussions based on ideas aggregated from various sources; self, peer, and teacher evaluations of in-class student presentations; personalized coaching to improve presentation skills; analysis of live, recorded, and/or mock presentations.

第2回:
Visual, verbal, and vocal delivery skills.
Pre-class study: Reflect on what you think is important when presenting. (1 hour).
Post Class Study: Online Writing submissions. Presentation Preparation (3 hours).
第4回:
Role of non-verbal communication
Presentation 1 preparation
Pre-class study: Review of Week 1 presentation (1 hour)
Post-class study: Research for Outside-class presentation (3 hours)
第6回:
Working with nervousness.
Pre-class study: Preparing for in-class presentation. Submission to online forum. (1 hour).
Post-class study: Research for Outside-class presentation. Analyzing a classmate’s presentation (3 hours)
第8回:
Presentation 2 preparation.
Pre-class study: Language of presentations Quiz preparation (1 hour).
Post-class study: Research for online sources related to presentations. Preparing for in-class discussion on presentation article (3 hours)
第10回:
Dealing with questions.
Pre-class study: Read and prepare notes for article on dealing with difficult questions in presentations (1 hour).
Post-class study: Research for online sources related to presentations. Work on Final report draft submission (3 hours).
第12回:
Using visual aids.
Pre-class study: Final Report submission checklist (1 hour).
Post-class study: Redrafting of Final Report presentation. (3 hours)
第14回:
Course summary.
Pre-class study: Preparing for Final Presentation (1 hour).
Post-class study: Reflection on materials presented in online sources related to presentations (3 hours).
トピック.授業外学習2: Each week, students will write short answers to discussion questions based on in-class discussions and reading assignments. Students will also need to prepare materials and set aside time to rehearse for their three, in-class, individual presentations. To that end, students should be familiar with presentation software, such as Power Point, in both Japanese and English, for the purpose of creating and using computerized visual aids.

教科書/Required texts1: There are no set texts for this course; however, the teacher will assign readings and direct students to various multi-media sources to guide them in their learning.
評価.参考文献・資料Reference books0:
DiResta, Diane. 2009. Knockout Presentations: How to Deliver Your Message with Power, Punch, and Pizzazz. Chandler House Press.

Garr, Reynolds. 2011. Presentation Zen: Simple ideas on presentation design and delivery. New Riders.
成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading2: (40%) Weekly writing/reading assignments will be graded on the relevance and depth of students' written responses and in-class discussions of assigned readings. (30%) Students will give 3, individual, in-class presentations. Guidelines for each presentation will be distributed in class.
評価.成績評価Grading3:
備考　Note
Weekly writing/reading assignments (40%), in-class presentations (30%), final written report (final report examination)(30%). Attendance is vital; students who miss more than 2 classes will not be able to receive a credit for this course.
